attributes.action: end the temporary reduction in VAT as it has provided no worthwhile benefit to consumers but will result in additional tax burdens for them.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The cut in VAT to 15% has had no benefit to consumers. Retail outlets determine a selling price, and then back-calculate VAT. For this reason, and as a trip down any High Street will show, the vast majority of items are still priced 'to sell' - i.e. at £n.99, or £n99  etc.  As this VAT cut is expected to cost £12.5 billion, the Government should be pragmatic and ditch it now in order to reduce the coming burden on taxpayers identified in the recent Budget.
